title: senhorbitcoins
author: senhorbitcoins
content: What is the promising currency? In this low market, there are always some interesting coins for miners, being in some cases more profitable than the most popular ones.But sometimes that coin that is starting may not be worth anything today, but it has an innovative project that in the future can help leverage its price in the market. Thus, those who once looked down on this coin may regret it for the rest of their lives. Will the humiliated be exalted?Tell us.

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Quote from: senhorbitcoins on June 26, 2022, 10:49:06 PMWhat is the promising currency? In this low market, there are always some interesting coins for miners, being in some cases more profitable than the most popular ones.But sometimes that coin that is starting may not be worth anything today, but it has an innovative project that in the future can help leverage its price in the market. Thus, those who once looked down on this coin may regret it for the rest of their lives. Will the humiliated be exalted?Tell us.It depends on a lot of factors.Personally I still mine Ethereum as the most profitable coin for GPU mining so far but as a side experiment I mine CPU coin Raptoreum which has a really low value in dollars but its developers have said it clear,we don't care how much time it takes,we know we will make it a great coin and I believe them so far that is why I mine this coin as a side experiment.To mine other GPU coins except Ethereum and Ethereum Classic it doesn't make a whole lot of sense so that is why almost everyone mines them.

comments.body: Quote from: senhorbitcoins on June 26, 2022, 10:49:06 PMWhat is the promising currency? In this low market, there are always some interesting coins for miners, being in some cases more profitable than the most popular ones.But sometimes that coin that is starting may not be worth anything today, but it has an innovative project that in the future can help leverage its price in the market. Thus, those who once looked down on this coin may regret it for the rest of their lives. Will the humiliated be exalted?When are they going to lunched Pi crypto app?

comments.author: senhorbitcoins
comments.body: WHERE has information about mining. Mining with gpu. hiveos? information about network difficulty average time of a new block?

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: Most people mine ETH with GPUs and Bitcoin and Litecoin with ASICs. There aren’t that many new coins these days that are POW. POW means you can mine it. Most are POS and they are tokens of ETH which you can’t mine. You buy those on exchanges directly.You can mine other coins which use similar Algos like ETH however the profitability will be very similar. Because most farms have bots which are finding the most profitable coins and they switch their mining around. So there is no secret coin out there.

comments.author: 5W-KILO
comments.body: I mine Ethereum and change it to Gala and Shiba every 24 hours, I plan to keep going this for a month or two before switching to Matic and Avalanche, since Ethereum is going proof of stake I have lose interest in the project, at this rate only God knows if PoS will make Eth better or worse.

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: I mine ETHI mine BTCI mine LTCI mine DogeI sell all the ETH I keep the rest.

comments.author: Coinfarm ventures
comments.body: I mine too many coins to count since I have profit switching, so all I can say is I don't mine ETH.I might buy some of the Goldshell ASICs like the KD-lite or HS-lite because of the PoS risk of video cards.

comments.author: VRExpress
comments.body: Quote from: Coinfarm ventures on June 28, 2022, 10:17:48 PMI mine too many coins to count since I have profit switching, so all I can say is I don't mine ETH.I might buy some of the Goldshell ASICs like the KD-lite or HS-lite because of the PoS risk of video cards.Is this Asic miner  better option than graphic cards? How much is the cost of this Asic miner and is your point about the profitability wise? I still think that GPUs will be a lot cheaper than Asic miners as we go down in this bear market season.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: VRExpress on June 29, 2022, 08:18:28 AMQuote from: Coinfarm ventures on June 28, 2022, 10:17:48 PMI mine too many coins to count since I have profit switching, so all I can say is I don't mine ETH.I might buy some of the Goldshell ASICs like the KD-lite or HS-lite because of the PoS risk of video cards.Is this Asic miner  better option than graphic cards? How much is the cost of this Asic miner and is your point about the profitability wise? I still think that GPUs will be a lot cheaper than Asic miners as we go down in this bear market season.This ASIC is only for Kadenahttps://www.asicminervalue.com/miners/goldshell/kd-maxBetter buy asics for bitcoin or litecon, because I do not believe in the future of the cadena coin. Or wait for new opportunities to invest in GPU mining.

comments.author: Coinfarm ventures
comments.body: Quote from: VRExpress on June 29, 2022, 08:18:28 AMIs this Asic miner  better option than graphic cards? How much is the cost of this Asic miner and is your point about the profitability wise?Since my after-tax power cost is just 5.3¢, some of the moderate efficiency ASICs like the Bitmain S19 95T, Avalon 1246 or Goldshell KD-lite make economic sense. Most of the Goldshells are overpriced but not some of the 'lite' series. I can get a 250 day payback time on a GPU rig or 400-500 days on an ASIC. If it goes below 400 days, I would consider the ASIC over the GPU because of the risk of PoS, even though the yield is lower.Quote from: VRExpress on June 29, 2022, 08:18:28 AMI still think that GPUs will be a lot cheaper than Asic miners as we go down in this bear market season.I agree, but I don't want to buy video cards until after PoS or if/when PoS gets postponed for at least 6 more months. If I buy anything these days it will be an ASIC, but most likely I will just save fiat $ in anticipation of cheap video cards.Quote from: FP91G on June 29, 2022, 03:16:47 PMBetter buy asics for bitcoin or litecon, because I do not believe in the future of the cadena coin.It doesn't hurt to diversify. The Kadena dev team recently said they have no plan to introduce PoS. As long as the payback period makes sense, I will consider a KD lite. I don't believe in the future of ETH so I diversified to a basket of GPU coins (which are actually more profitable for my hardware). I already have a few older-gen Scrypt ASICs as well.

comments.author: Ketesnuko
comments.body: Flux 24/7, I believe in this project more than anything, another one that can give you rest of mind is XEC, it's very BTC friendly in price recovery, if BTC pumps XEC will follow, I like coins like this, just like NEO too, I will stick with XEC and FLUX instead.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: Coinfarm ventures on June 29, 2022, 03:18:09 PMQuote from: VRExpress on June 29, 2022, 08:18:28 AMIs this Asic miner  better option than graphic cards? How much is the cost of this Asic miner and is your point about the profitability wise?Since my after-tax power cost is just 5.3¢, some of the moderate efficiency ASICs like the Bitmain S19 95T, Avalon 1246 or Goldshell KD-lite make economic sense. Most of the Goldshells are overpriced but not some of the 'lite' series. I can get a 250 day payback time on a GPU rig or 400-500 days on an ASIC. If it goes below 400 days, I would consider the ASIC over the GPU because of the risk of PoS, even though the yield is lower.Quote from: VRExpress on June 29, 2022, 08:18:28 AMI still think that GPUs will be a lot cheaper than Asic miners as we go down in this bear market season.I agree, but I don't want to buy video cards until after PoS or if/when PoS gets postponed for at least 6 more months. If I buy anything these days it will be an ASIC, but most likely I will just save fiat $ in anticipation of cheap video cards.Quote from: FP91G on June 29, 2022, 03:16:47 PMBetter buy asics for bitcoin or litecon, because I do not believe in the future of the cadena coin.It doesn't hurt to diversify. The Kadena dev team recently said they have no plan to introduce PoS. As long as the payback period makes sense, I will consider a KD lite. I don't believe in the future of ETH so I diversified to a basket of GPU coins (which are actually more profitable for my hardware). I already have a few older-gen Scrypt ASICs as well.I think that with an asic payback of more than 400 days, it is not worth buying. Probably better to buy coins. The price of coins may rise, but the manufacturer, which is a monopoly, will release more powerful ASICs. And you run the risk of being left with an unprofitable ASIC that no one needs.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: I'd like to consider that I only mine BTC.  I do have some GPUs mining Ethereum on Nicehash, but it pays out with Bitcoin so to me it is the same as when I used to mine Bitcoin with GPUs back in the day.  I do have some ETH staking in the 2.0 contract earning interest, so that's sort of like mining Ethereum I guess...  For the most part though, it's all about stacking BTC.  Sometimes I might make investments with that BTC, like metaverse land or coins I need to use for something, but the vast majority of crypto assets I have are in Bitcoin.

comments.author: Outhue
comments.body: I will keep mining Ethereum because it's the most profitable for GPU miners, the mining difficulty of coins that I want to hold are still very high which is making mining very boring as we speak, I want price to keep crumbling and mining to be less profitable in dollar this is the only way that miners won't be able to keep mining.

comments.author: DesertMiner
comments.body: Currently mining ETH and RVN, selling ETH for BTC, holding RVN.

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Quote from: DerekFlips on June 30, 2022, 11:40:36 AMQuote from: senhorbitcoins on June 26, 2022, 10:49:06 PMWhat is the promising currency? In this low market, there are always some interesting coins for miners, being in some cases more profitable than the most popular ones.But sometimes that coin that is starting may not be worth anything today, but it has an innovative project that in the future can help leverage its price in the market. Thus, those who once looked down on this coin may regret it for the rest of their lives. Will the humiliated be exalted?Tell us.How can I mine for shitcoin? Can I mine for Doge? or Which altcoins or shitcoins are mining available? Please help I would love to join the mining community but lack the knowledge  You can mine almost any coin you want,you just put your mining rig to https://www.unmineable.com/ and choose the coin you want to mine.You then follow the guides there at how to configure your miner to mine to the unmineable pool and that is all,you receive your payout based on the coin that you have chosen to mine.There is one downside though,that due to conversions to pay you in the currency of your choice it is not the most profitable thing to do,if you want better profitability mine Ethereum,if you are obsessed at mining coins that are otherwise not mineable you use that site.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: DerekFlips on June 30, 2022, 11:40:36 AMQuote from: senhorbitcoins on June 26, 2022, 10:49:06 PMWhat is the promising currency? In this low market, there are always some interesting coins for miners, being in some cases more profitable than the most popular ones.But sometimes that coin that is starting may not be worth anything today, but it has an innovative project that in the future can help leverage its price in the market. Thus, those who once looked down on this coin may regret it for the rest of their lives. Will the humiliated be exalted?Tell us.How can I mine for shitcoin? Can I mine for Doge? or Which altcoins or shitcoins are mining available? Please help I would love to join the mining community but lack the knowledge  You can mine any coin and then sell it on a crypto exchange and buy shitcoins. Mining Doge requires an ASIC. Use this calculator to calculate the best profit for a graphics card.https://whattomine.com/gpusI made mistakes and lost profit with shitcoins, so I do not advise you to start mining for this purpose.
